The package was pulled to the side and opened and the inner packages were discovered to have all the DG markings.

item.title: Report X-2025030441
item.description:
Report X-2025030441

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: BALDWIN PARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHEN IRREGULAR BOX PULLER NOTICED SOILED TOP/SIDES OF THE BOX AND AN STRONG ODOR DETECTED. EMPLOYEE DIDN'T TOUCH THE BOX AND CALLED HIS SUPERVISOR, WHO IN TURN CALLED A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET BEFORE BRINGING THE BOX AND SUPPLIES TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

item.title: Report E-2025030068
item.description:
Report E-2025030068

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 28, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1719 was punctured and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found at the LAX location. Inside of the fiberboard box was two plastic bags containing containing six metal bottles. The cap on one was damaged causing a release inside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025030098
item.description:
Report E-2025030098

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 20, a Veolia employee was unloading a trailer at Veolia's Richmond facility. The employee removed a 275 gallon IBC tote from the trailer using a forklift and placed it on the ground. The employee then went to grab the next pallet, and as he was placing it down, he noticed a small stain of liquid on the ground underneath the tote. Upon noticing that liquid was dripping onto the ground, the employee grabbed absorbent pads and placed it around the tote to prevent the spill from spreading. Approximately two ounces of hazardous waste liquid spilled within the two minutes it took to control the spill. The material in the tote was transferred to another tote using a gravity feed. It was determined that the leak originated from the bottom of the tote since there was no evidence of visible damage to any other part of the tote. However, since the tote was inside a cage, it was not possible to pinpoint the exact location of the hole on the bottom of the tote.

item.title: Report E-2025020243
item.description:
Report E-2025020243

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: San Jose
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIR PRODUCTS AND CHEMICALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 253900
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver was traveling about 7 mph while attempting to make a U-turn on a remote road. Tires on passenger side of trailer entered soft shoulder causing trailer to roll. There were no 3rd parties, no injuries, and some damage to barbwire fence and street sign. Crisis Center was notified and activated. Local Vehicle Recovery Teams from Galt and Santa Clara have responded to the scene. Local fire department responded to scene. Corporate Safety and Environmental notified. Our Air Products driver arrived at the scheduled delivery location with a fully loaded Nitrogen trailer when he approached a gate. The driver exited his vehicle and quickly determined he was at the wrong location. Upon returning to his vehicle, he decided to perform a U-Turn on a narrow two-lane road which had an incline. During the maneuvering, the back end of the trailer dug into soft shoulder and mud, the weight of the trailer pushed the tractor which caused the trailer to break away from the 5th wheel and roll against the tractor. The trailer then rolled over onto its side across the roadway. The trailer released liquid Nitrogen due to the PSV line being damaged. During the roll over event, the tractors fuel tank was ruptured causing a diesel spill onto the ground. There were no injuries reported, and no other vehicles involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025030153
item.description:
Report E-2025030153

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1648 ET, XPO-ULA notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 4 cups of Bloc 8n Naphthoquinone solution released from a metal drum due to unknown cause The release impacted inside trailer#313-2895. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor and the steel grate on the trailer floor in a 2x3 area as a result of improper loading. The contractor cleaned-up the release using oil dry and overpacked the damaged drum into one 95-fallon DF for waste disposal. A 16-gallon DF containing impacted pallet pieces was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all the waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
